arts.sum: A list of Pompey’s rivals’ results from Saturday following a statement Fratton Park win.

arts.ttl: Frank Lampard admits Portsmouth defeat was 'first sign' of a big eye-opener for him at Coventry
arts.sum: Callum Lang enjoyed a four-goal fiesta against Coventry City in a big win for Portsmouth.

arts.ttl: ‘The highlight of my career’: Four-goal Portsmouth sensation’s gratitude to Fratton faithful for day he’ll never forget against Coventry City
arts.sum: Callum Lang savoured the high point of his football career after his stunning four-goal super show against Coventry City.

arts.ttl: 'Running out of superlatives': Portsmouth boss John Mousinho on remarkable Fratton Park day against Coventry
arts.sum: John Mousinho reflected on a remarkable Callum Lang performance and insisted: I’m running out of superlatives.

arts.ttl: Frank Lampard pinpoints worrying trait in shocking Coventry City performance at Portsmouth
arts.sum: “They were very good last week and even at West Brom we could look for positives in the game, but the second half today was a real clear show of what football’s about, especially in the Championship. Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group.

arts.ttl: Championship roundup: Lang hits four in Pompey cruise as Coventry crumble
arts.sum: Portsmouth come from behind for 4-1 win at Fratton Park Sheffield Wednesday see off Stoke 2-0 despite early red Callum Lang scored a sensational four goals as Portsmouth came from behind to thrash Coventry 4-1 at Fratton Park, giving Frank Lampard, the visitors’ manager, a further reminder of how tough a division the second tier can be. Norman Bassette had given Coventry the lead inside 150 seconds but Lang – who had not previously scored a professional hat-trick – turned them around with a magnificent individual performance. It added some weight to Pompey’s survival hopes – they started the day in the drop zone – and gave them a fourth home game on the spin without defeat. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Lang nets four as Pompey thump Coventry | Lampard: It wasn't good enough
arts.sum: Callum Lang scored a sensational four goals as Portsmouth came from behind to thrash Coventry 4-1 at Fratton Park, giving visiting boss Frank Lampard a further reminder of how tough a division the second tier can be.

arts.ttl: 'The perfect 10, Phenomenal energy, Excellent summer signing': Neil Allen's Portsmouth player ratings against Coventry
arts.sum: Callum Lang scored four times as the Blues fought back from behind to stun Coventry in a remarkable Fratton Park match.

arts.ttl: Coventry City player ratings as woeful Sky Blues capitulate after early Bassette lead - Andy Turner
arts.sum: Pompey, however, were back on level terms 11 minutes later when City failed to deal with a corner and the ball was played to Lang on the edge of the box where he hit a hard and low shot, going through Jay Dasilva’s legs and beating goalkeeper Bard Collins at his near post. The Sky Blues raced into an early lead when Ephron Mason-Clark took on and beat his marker before sending in a low cross to the far post for Norman Bassette to tap home from close range.

arts.ttl: Fantastic four-goal Lang gives Lampard a Frank reminder of Championship’s depth
arts.sum: Pompey started the day in the relegation zone.
